fields.name: Grizzly on CentOS 6.4
fields.description: This option will install the OpenStack Grizzly packages using CentOS as a base operating system. With high availability features built in, you are getting a robust, enterprise-grade OpenStack deployment.

multinode.description: In this configuration the OpenStack controller is deployed separately from the compute and cinder nodes. This mode assumes the presence of 1 controller node and 1 or more compute/cinder nodes. You can add more nodes to scale your cloud later.

ha_compact.description: This configuration requires multiple OpenStack controllers (3+) and provides high availability for all OpenStack components, including MySQL/Galera, RabbitMQ, and Cinder, as well as OpenStack API services. Select this configuration if you want to build a production-grade OpenStack cloud with 6 nodes or more.

controller.name: Controller
controller.description: The controller initiates orchestration activities and provides an external API.  Other components like Glance (image storage), Keystone (identity management), Horizon (OpenStack dashboard) and Nova-Scheduler are installed on the controller as well.

compute.name: Compute
compute.description: A compute node creates, manages and terminates virtual machine instances.

cinder.name: Cinder
cinder.description: Cinder provides an infrastructure for managing block storage volumes in OpenStack.  Block storage can be used for database storage, expandable file systems, or providing a server with access to raw block level storage.

ceph-osd.name: Ceph OSD
ceph-osd.description: Ceph OSD is the object storage daemon for the Ceph distributed file system.  It is responsible for storing objects on a local file system and providing access to them over the network, for example to Glance.

savanna.label: Install Savanna
savanna.description: If selected, Savanna component will be installed

murano.label: Install Murano
murano.description: If selected, Murano component will be installed

debug.label: OpenStack debug logging
debug.description: Debug logging mode provides more information, but requires more disk space.

auto_assign_floating_ip.label: Auto assign floating IP
auto_assign_floating_ip.description: If selected, OpenStack will automatically assign a floating IP to a new instance

vlan_splinters.label: Enable 'OVS VLAN splinters' feature (Neutron only)
vlan_splinters.description: Use VLAN splinters Open vSwitch method on necessary network interfaces

values.label: KVM
values.description: Choose this type of hypervisor if you run OpenStack on hardware

values.label: QEMU
values.description: Choose this type of hypervisor if you run OpenStack on virtual hosts.

start_guests_on_host_boot.label: Start guests on host boot
start_guests_on_host_boot.description: Whether to (re-)start guests when the host reboots. If enabled, this option causes guests assigned to the host to be unconditionally restarted when nova-compute starts. If the guest is found to be stopped, it starts. If it is found to be running, it reboots.

use_cow_images.label: Use qcow format for images
use_cow_images.description: For most cases you will want qcow format. If it's disabled, raw image format will be used to run VMs. OpenStack with raw format currently does not support snapshotting.

values.label: Filter scheduler
values.description: Currently the most advanced OpenStack scheduler. See the OpenStack documentation for details.

values.label: Simple scheduler
values.description: This is 'naive' scheduler which tries to find the least loaded host

auth_key.label: Public Key
auth_key.description: Public key(s) to include in authorized_keys on deployed nodes

volumes_lvm.label: Cinder LVM over iSCSI for volumes
volumes_lvm.description: Requires at least one Cinder node

volumes_ceph.label: Ceph RBD for volumes
volumes_ceph.description: Requires at least two Ceph-OSD nodes

images_ceph.label: Ceph RBD for images
images_ceph.description: Requires at least two Ceph-OSD nodes

objects_ceph.label: Ceph rados-gw for objects
objects_ceph.description: Requires at least two Ceph-OSD nodes, incompatible with Swift

osd_pool_size.label: Ceph object replication factor
osd_pool_size.description: Defines the number of object replicas in Ceph pools. At least that many Ceph-OSD nodes must be deployed.

fields.name: RHOS 3.0 for RHEL 6.4
fields.description: This option will install the Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenStack Platform using RHEL as a base operating system.  With high availability features built in, you are getting a robust enterprise-grade OpenStack deployment.

multinode.description: In this configuration the OpenStack controller is deployed separately from the compute and cinder nodes. This mode assumes the presence of 1 controller node and 1 or more compute/cinder nodes. You can add more nodes to scale your cloud later.

ha_compact.description: This configuration requires multiple OpenStack controllers (3+) and provides high availability for all OpenStack components, including MySQL, QPID, and Cinder, as well as OpenStack API services. Select this configuration if you want to build a production-grade OpenStack cloud with 6 nodes or more.
